field.name: var_import
field.description: number of resampling of each explanatory variable to measure the relative importance of each variable for each selected model
field.title: resampling

field.name: do_full_models
field.description: calibrate & evaluate models with the whole dataset?
field.title: do full models

field.name: do.classif
field.description: true for a classification, false for a regression forest. Currently ignored in biomod2 source
field.title: do.classif

field.name: ntree
field.description: Number of trees to grow. This should not be set to too small a number, to ensure that every input row gets predicted at least a few times.
field.title: ntree

field.name: mtry
field.description: Number of variables randomly sampled as candidates at each split. Note that the default values are different for classification (sqrt(p) where p is number of variables in ‘x’) and regression (p/3)
field.title: mtry

field.name: nodesize
field.description: Minimum size of terminal nodes. Setting this number larger causes smaller trees to be grown (and thus take less time).
field.title: nodesize

field.name: maxnodes
field.description: Maximum number of terminal nodes trees in the forest can have. If not given, trees are grown to the maximum possible (subject to limits by nodesize)
field.title: maxnodes
